pullRequest.body:
- collect some very common variables
- use refine and \mapsto instead of refine' and => (both are preferred now)

----------

Easy to review. Best reviewed commit by commit (each says what it does). Preparatory cleaning for #10004.

nodes.body: Addressed all comments. (Sorry for the force-push; only the last two commits are new.)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7671258080/job/20909229183)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7671258080/job/20909228813)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7671258080/job/20909229016)
Please don't move explicit arguments, especially assumptions, to `variable`s: this way `theorem` statements below miss important parts.

Another spelling (optional, both are accepted in Mathlib):
```suggestion
    (h_diff :  a , HasFDerivAt (F  a) (F' a) x) :
```
This doesn't work yet: "expected token". (Presumably needs some notation open.) I've left it as-is.
I used a wrong middle dot. this one should work: `(F  a)`

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Calculus/ParametricIntegralInterval): small clean-ups
